abstract: Carl Icahn said that Yahoo should offer to sell itself to Microsoft for nearly $49.5 billion and laid out his plan for the company, where he to succeed in taking control of it. Interestingly, Yahoo didn’t say the price was too low.
snippet: Carl Icahn said that Yahoo should offer to sell itself to Microsoft for nearly $49.5 billion and laid out his plan for the company, where he to succeed in taking control of it. Interestingly, Yahoo didn’t say the price was too low.
lead_paragraph: Carl C. Icahn, the billionaire activist investor, said Friday that Yahoo should offer to sell itself to Microsoft for approximately $49.5 billion, about $2 billion more than Microsoft offered last month, after getting rid of an employee severance plan which he described as a costly “poison pill.”

headline.main: Icahn vs. Yahoo: The Latest Exchange
